DUE TO THE CRISIS SITUATION IN UKRAINE AND INCREASED MILITARY ACTIVITY, BASED ON OPERATIONAL SITUATION, AIRSPACE USERS MIGHT EXPECT TACTICAL FLIGHT RESTRICTIONS IN EPWWGL, EPWWGH ACC WARSZAWA SECTORS. DEP/ARR EPWA, EPMO VIA SID OLILA/STAR SORIX MIGHT BE TACTICALLY RESTRICTED TO MAINTAIN FL LOWER THAN FL225 FOR DISTANCE OF 100NM AFTER PASSING POINT OLILA OR PRIOR REACHING POINT SORIX. THIS SHOULD BE TAKEN INTO ACCOUNT DURING FUEL CALCULATION FOR FLIGHT.

DUE TO THE CRISIS SITUATION IN UKRAINE AND INCREASED MILITARY ACTIVITY, BASED ON OPERATIONAL SITUATION, AIRSPACE USERS MIGHT EXPECT TACTICAL FLIGHT RESTRICTIONS IN EPWWNL, EPWWNH, EPWWEL, EPWWEH ACC WARSZAWA SECTORS. DEP/ARR EPWA, EPMO VIA SID BAMSO/STAR NEPOX MIGHT BE TACTICALLY RESTRICTED TO MAINTAIN FL LOWER THAN FL225 FOR DISTANCE OF 100NM-140NM AFTER PASSING LAST POINT OF SID OR PRIOR REACHING FIRST POINT OF STAR.

AX0002/24 AIC RESTRICTION HLLL/TRIPOLI FIR VALIDITY: 02OCT-UFN IATA IN FLIGHT BROADCAST PROCEDURE (IFBP) - AFI REGION 1.LISTENING WATCH IT IS RECOMMENDED THAT A LISTENING WATCH SHOULD BE MNTN ON THE DESIGNATED FREQ (126.9MHZ), 10 MIN BFR ENTERING THE DESIGNATED AIRSPACE TIL LVE THE AIRSPACE. FOR AN ACFT TKOF FM AN AD LOCATED WI THE LATERAL LIMITS OF THE DESIGNATED AIRSPACE, LISTENING WATCH SHOULD START AS SOON AS APPROPRIATE AND BE MNTN TIL LVE THE AIRSPACE. 2.BROADCASTS INTERVALS IT IS RECOMMENDED THAT A BCST SHOULD BE PRONOUNCED IN ENGLISH AS FLW: -10 MIN BFR, ENTERING AN FIR WI THE IFBP REGION -UPON ENTERING AN FIR WI THE IFBP REGION -AS SOON AS PRACTICABLE WHEN DEP FM AN AD LOCATED WI THE IFBP REGION -10 MIN BFR XNG OR JOINING AN ATS RTE OR XNG AN AWY OR WPT -EV 20 MIN -BFR A CHANGE IN FL -UPON RCH THE INTENDED FL -AT ANY OTHER TIME CONSIDERED NECESSARY BY THE PILOT. NOTE 1: IN THE INTEREST OF REDUCING CONGESTION ON THE IFBP FREQ, PILOTS MAY EXER DISCRETION TO OMIT CLOSELY SPACED REPETITIVE IFBP REPORTS, HOWEVER BCST INTERVALS SHOULD NOT EXCEED 20 MIN. NOTE 2: IT IS RECOMMENDED THAT THE IFBP FREQ 126.9 IS CLOSELY MNT AT ALL TIMES WHEN IN THE REGION; FOR EXAMPLE, NOT TO TURN OFF OR REDUCE VOLUME LEVELS ON THE TRANSMITTING/RECEIVING FREQ. 3.BROADCAST PROCEDURE IT IS RECOMMENDED A BCST MSG SHOULD BE STRUCTURED AS FLW: ALL STATIONS THIS IS ABC123 (FLT NR) IN THE XXXX (FIR NAME) FIR. ABC123 (FLT NR) AT FL (ALT MNTN) DIRECTION BOUND (DIRECTION) IN THE XXXX (FIR NAME) FIR. 4. OPERATING PROCEDURES 4.1. CHANGES IN CRUISING LVL ARE CONSIDERED NECESSARY BY PILOTS TO AVOID TFC CONFLICTS, FOR WEATHER AVOIDANCE, OR OTHER VALID OPR REASONS. WHEN CRUISING LVL CHANGES ARE UNAVOIDABLE, ALL AVBL ACFT LGT, WHICH WOULD IMPR THE VISUAL DETECTION OF THE ACFT, SHOULD BE DISPLAYED WHILE CHANGING LEVELS. 4.2. COLLISION AVOIDANCE IF, ON RECEIPT OF A TFC INFO BCST FM ANOTHER ACFT, A PILOT TAKES A DECISION THAT IMMEDIATE ACTION IS NECESSARY TO AVOID AN IMMINENT COLLISION RISK TO HIS ACFT AND THIS CANNOT BE ACHIEVED FLW THE RIGHT-OF-WAY PROVISIONS OF ANNEX 2, HE SHOULD: UNLESS AN ALTERNATIVE MANEUVER APPEARS MORE APPROPRIATE, CLIMB OR DESCEND 500FT; DISPLAY ALL AVBL ACFT LGT WHICH WOULD IMPR THE VISUAL DETECTION OF THE ACFT; ASAP REPLY TO THE BCST ADVISING ACTION BEING TAKEN, AND SPECIFY ALT MNTN; NOTIFY THE ACTION TAKEN ON THE APPROPRIATE ATS FREQ; AS SOON AS THE SITUATION HAS BEEN RECTIFIED, RESUME THE ALLOCATED FL, NOTIFYING THE ACTION ON THE APPROPRIATE ATS FREQ. 4.3. NORMAL POSITION REPORTING PROCEDURES NML PSN REP PROC SHOULD BE CONT AT ALL TIMES, REGARDLESS OF ANY ACTION TAKEN TO INITIATE OR ACK A TFC INFO BCST. 4.4. OPERATION OF TRANSPONDERS PILOTS SHALL ENSURE THAT TRANSPONDER PROC AS CONTAINED IN ICAO PANS OPS DOC 8168 ARE COMPLIED WITH AND IN THE ABSENCE OF OTHER DIRECTIONS FM ATC, OPR THE TRANSPONDER ON MODE A AND C CODE 2000. PILOTS SHALL ENSURE OPERATION OF TRANSPONDERS EVEN WHEN OUTSIDE RADAR COVERAGE IN ORDER TO ENABLE TCAS EQUIPPED ACFT TO IDENTIFY CONFLICTING TFC. USE OF TCAS IN ACCORDANCE WITH ICAO ANNEX 6 ALL TURBINE-ENG AIRPLANES OF A MAX CERTIFICATED TKOF MASS IN EXCESS OF 5700 KG OR AUTH TO CARRY MORE THAN 19 PAX SHALL BE EQUIPPED WITH ACAS II. IATA RECOMMENDS THE USE OF AN OPERABLE TCAS WHEN OPR WI THE CONTINENT OF AFRICA; AND RECOMMENDS SELECTION OF TA/RA MODE AT MAX RANGE. 4.5. USE OF SLOP: SLOP IS PROMOTED IN AFI REGION. 5. THE IFBP IN AFI IN MANY FIRS IN THE AFI REGION COM BOTH FIXED AND MOBILE HAVE EITHER NOT BEEN IMPLEMENTED OR OPR WELL BLW THE REQUIRED RELIABILITY. THIS HAS AN IMPACT ON THE PROPER PROVISION OF ATS, ESPECIALLY FIS. CONSEQUENTLY, THE AFI REGIONAL TECHNICAL CONFERENCE HAS DECIDED THAT THE IATA IN-FLT BCST PROC (IFBP) SHOULD BE USED WI DESIGNATED FIRS IN THE REGION AS AN INTERIM MEASURE TIL SUCH TIME AS COM FAC AFFECTING THE FIRS IN QUESTION HAVE BEEN IMPROVED. 6. DESIGNATED FREQ IN AFI FOR THE IFBP IS 126.9 MHZ. 7. IN THE AFI REGION THE IFBP SHOULD BE APPLIED IN THE FLW FIRS AND AIRSPACES: ASMARA, BRAZZAVILLE, KANO, KHARTOUM, KINSHASA, LUANDA, LUSAKA, TRIPOLI, MOGADISHU, NIAMEY, N DJAMENA, DAKAR.

AX0002/24 AIC RESTRICTION SUBJECT: REINFORCING THE FPL ADHERENCE CAMPAIGN VALIDITY:22MAY24-UFN TO AVOID UNFORESEEN TRAFFIC OVERLOAD OF ATC SECTORS IN EUROPE THE EUROCONTROL NETWORK MANAGER STRONGLY EXPECTS ALL IFR FLIGHTS THAT THEY WILL ACTUALLY BE OPERATED AT THE CRUISING ALTITUDE FILED IN THEIR FLIGHT PLAN. INFLIGHT CHANGE IN REQUESTED FLIGHT LEVELS SHOULD BE AVOIDED. BASED ON THE RECENT EXPERIENCES IN BUDAPEST FIR SOME IFR FLIGHTS (PARTICULARLY DEPARTING AND ARRIVING FROM/TO LHBP) ARE OBSERVED PLANNING THEIR FLIGHTS AT LOW CRUISING ALTITUDES (BELOW 9500 FEET) TO AVOID TRAFFIC RESTRICTIONS IMPOSED ON THE LOWER ACC SECTORS IN BUDAPEST CTA. HUNGAROCONTROL DRAWS THE ATTENTION OF OPERATORS PERFORMING SUCH FLIGHTS WITHIN BUDAPEST FIR TO THE FOLLOWING: - HUNGAROCONTROL CONSIDERS THESE FLIGHTS BEING PLANNED INTENTIONALLY IN UNCONTROLLED AIRSPACE CONSEQUENTLY THEY WILL BE EXPECTED TO OPERATE AT THE REQUESTED ALTITUDE FOR THE GIVEN SECTION OF THE ROUTE FILED IN THEIR FLIGHT PLANS. - EXCEPT IN AN EMERGENCY, FOR IFR FLIGHTS INTENTIONALLY OPERATING IN UNCONTROLLED AIRSPACE ATC CANNOT GUARANTEE THE ENTRY INTO CONTROLLED AIRSPACE BY APPROVING A CHANGE IN THEIR REQUESTED FLIGHT LEVEL (ESPECIALLY,IF TRAFFIC RESTRICTIONS ARE IN FORCE IN THE ATC SECTORS CONCERNED). - FLIGHTS WITH CRUISING ALTITUDES BELOW 9500 FEET - OUTSIDE OF TMAS AND CTRS - WILL OPERATE IN UNCONTROLLED AIRSPACE (ICAO CLASS G), IN WHICH TRAFFIC UNKNOWN TO THE APPROPRIATE ATS UNIT CAN BE OPERATING, WHERE THE RESPONSIBILITY FOR THE PREVENTION OF COLLISION SOLELY RELIES ON THE AIR CREWS.
VOR/DME OMA 117.9MHZ/CH126X, VOR PART U/S DUE TO MAINTENANCE.
